examples: He's certainly very chirpy for a man whose house has just been bulldozed down.

definitions.definition: To push someone over by heading straight over them. Often used in conjunction with "over".
examples: He just ran across the field bulldozing everyone over.

definitions.definition: To push into a heap, as a bulldozer does.
examples: Again the animal had bulldozed all of its bedding into a heap at one end of its cage.

definitions.definition: To shoot down an idea immediately and forcefully.
examples: That was a good suggestion, but you just bulldozed it.

definitions.definition: To intimidate ; to restrain or coerce by intimidation or violence ; used originally of the intimidation of black voters in Louisiana .

secondary_definitions: ( UK ) To push someone over by heading straight over them. Often used in conjunction with "over".
To push into a heap, as a bulldozer does.
( UK ) To shoot down an idea immediately and forcefully.
( US , slang , dated ) To intimidate ; to restrain or coerce by intimidation or violence ; used originally of the intimidation of black voters in Louisiana .
